intro: Ophiorrhiza monsvictoriae, commonly known as the Victoria's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Philippines. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement, and it produces small, white flowers with four petals. Its fruits are berries that contain a single seed, and it relies on specific host trees for both nutrients and structural support. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
